standard_metadata.standard_description: Apply properties of operations as strategies to add, subtract, factor, and expand linear expressions with rational coefficients.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Combining like terms with negative coefficients & distribution

hints.content: The minus sign in front of the parentheses means we multiply each term inside the parentheses by $\purple{-1}$:    $\qquad 7n \purple{-1(}\gray{4n-3}\purple{)} =7n \purple{-4n+3}$
Combine the $n$-terms:    $\qquad\pink{7n - 4n} + 3=\pink{3n} + 3$
The simplified expression is $3n+3$.
Distribute the $\purple{-5}$  to each term inside the parentheses:    $\qquad 8k \purple{-5(}\gray{-5k+3}\purple{)}= 8k + \purple{25k-15}  $
Combine the $k$-terms:    $\qquad\pink{8k + 25k} - 15=\pink{33k} - 15$
The simplified expression is  $33k-15$.
The minus sign in front of the parentheses means we multiply each term inside the parentheses by $\purple{-1}$:    $\qquad -3z \purple{-1(}\gray{-z-2}\purple{)} =-3z + \purple{z+2}$
Combine the $z$-terms:    $\qquad\pink{-3z + z} + 2=\pink{-2z} + 2$
The simplified expression is $-2z+2$.
Distribute the $\purple{8}$  to each term inside the parentheses:    $\qquad -r + \purple{8(}\gray{-5r-2}\purple{)} =-r \purple{-40r-16} $
Combine the $r$-terms:    $\qquad\pink{-r - 40r} - 16=\pink{-41r} - 16$
The simplified expression is $-41r-16$.
The minus sign in front of the parentheses means we multiply each term inside the parentheses by $\purple{-1}$:    $\qquad -k \purple{-1(}\gray{-8k+7}\purple{)} = -k + \purple{8k-7} $
Combine the $k$-terms:    $\qquad\pink{-k + 8k} - 7=\pink{7k} - 7$
The simplified expression is $7k-7$.
Distribute the $\purple{2}$  to each term inside the parentheses:    $\qquad -k + \purple{2(}\gray{-2k-5}\purple{)}=-k \purple{-4k-10}  $
Combine the $k$-terms:    $\qquad\pink{-k - 4k} - 10=\pink{-5k} - 10$
The simplified expression is $-5k-10$.
Distribute the $\purple{2}$  to each term inside the parentheses:    $\qquad 3n + \purple{2(}\gray{-2n-1}\purple{)} =3n \purple{-4n-2} $
Combine the $n$-terms:    $\qquad\pink{3n - 4n} - 2=\pink{-n} - 2$
The simplified expression is $-n-2$.
Distribute the $\purple{-3}$  to each term inside the parentheses:    $\qquad -y \purple{-3(}\gray{-3y+5}\purple{)} =-y + \purple{9y-15} $
Combine the $y$-terms:    $\qquad\pink{-y + 9y} - 15=\pink{8y} - 15$
The simplified expression is $8y-15$.
Distribute the $\purple{-4}$ to each term inside the parentheses:    $\qquad 2 \purple{-4(}\gray{5p+1}\purple{)} =2 \purple{-20p-4}$
Combine the numeric terms:   $\qquad\blue2 -20p\blue{-4}= -20p \blue{-2}$
The simplified expression is $-20p-2$.
Distribute the $\purple{4}$  to each term inside the parentheses:    $\qquad 1 + \purple{4(}\gray{6p-9}\purple{)} =1 + \purple{24p-36} $
Combine the numeric terms:    $\qquad  24p  \blue{+1 - 36}=24p \blue{-35}$
The simplified expression is $24p-35$.
Distribute the $\purple{-6}$  to each term inside the parentheses:    $\qquad 19 \purple{-6(}\gray{-k+4}\purple{)} =19 + \purple{6k-24} $
Combine the numeric terms:    $\qquad 6k  \blue{+19 - 24}=6k \blue{-5}$
The simplified expression is $6k-5$.
Distribute the $\purple{-6}$  to each term inside the parentheses:    $\qquad 19 \purple{-6(}\gray{-k-2}\purple{)} = 19 + \purple{6k+12} $
Combine the numeric terms:    $\qquad 6k  \blue{+19 + 12}=6k  \blue{+31}$
The simplified expression is $6k+31$.
Distribute the $\purple{-6}$  to each term inside the parentheses:    $\qquad 2 \purple{-6(}\gray{-5t+1}\purple{)} =2 + \purple{30t-6} $
Combine the numeric terms:    $\qquad 30t  \blue{+2 - 6}=30t \blue{-4}$
The simplified expression is $30t-4$.
Distribute the $\purple{4}$  to each term inside the parentheses:    $\qquad 10 + \purple{4(}\gray{-8q-4}\purple{)} =10 \purple{-32q-16}$
Combine the numeric terms:    $\qquad -32q  \blue{+10 - 16}=-32q \blue{-6}$
The simplified expression is $-32q-6$.
Distribute the $\purple{-4}$  to each term inside the parentheses:    $\qquad 8 \purple{-4(}\gray{-x+5}\purple{)} =8 + \purple{4x-20} $
Combine the numeric terms:    $\qquad 4x  \blue{+8 - 20}=4x \blue{-12}$
The simplified expression is $4x-12$.
Distribute the $\purple{7}$  to each term inside the parentheses:    $\qquad 5 + \purple{7(}\gray{8r-2}\purple{)} = 5 + \purple{56r-14} $
Combine the numeric terms:    $\qquad 56r  \blue{+5 - 14}=56r \blue{-9}$
The simplified expression is $56r-9$.
Distribute the $\purple{8}$  to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{8(}\gray{10-6q}\purple{)} + 3(-7q-2)= \purple{80-48q} + 3(-7q-2)  $
Distribute the $\purple{3}$  to each term inside the second set of parentheses:    $\qquad 80-48q + \purple{3(}\gray{-7q-2}\purple{)}=80-48q \purple{-21q-6} $
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{q}$-terms and numeric terms and  then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{-48q - 21q}  \blue{+80 - 6}=\pink{-69q}  \blue{+74}$
The simplified expression is $-69q+74$.
Distribute the $\purple{-3}$  to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{-3(}\gray{2+4k}\purple{)} + 7(2k-1) = \purple{-6-12k} + 7(2k-1) $
Distribute the $\purple{7}$ to each term inside the second set of parentheses:    $\qquad -6-12k + \purple{7(}\gray{2k-1}\purple{)} =-6-12k + \purple{14k-7} $
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{k}$-terms and numeric terms and  then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{-12k + 14k} \blue{-6 - 7}=\pink{2k} \blue{-13}$
The simplified expression is $2k-13$.
Distribute the $\purple{-5}$  to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{-5(}\gray{1-5k}\purple{)} - 4(2k+5) =\purple{-5+25k} - 4(2k+5) $
Distribute the $\purple{-4} $ to each term inside the second set of parentheses:    $\qquad -5+25k \purple{-4(}\gray{2k+5}\purple{)} =-5+25k \purple{-8k-20} $
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{k}$-terms and numeric terms and  then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{25k - 8k} \blue{-5 - 20}=\pink{17k} \blue{-25}$
The simplified expression is $17k-25$.
Distribute the $\purple{2}$ to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{2(}\gray{-14+r}\purple{)} - (-3r-5) =\purple{-28+2r} - (-3r-5) $

The minus sign in front of the second set of parentheses means we multiply each term inside the parentheses by $\purple{-1}$:    $\qquad -28+2r \purple{-1(}\gray{-3r-5}\purple{)} =-28+2r + \purple{3r+5} $
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{r}$-terms and numeric terms and  then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{2r + 3r} \blue{-28 + 5}=\pink{5r} \blue{-23}$
The simplified expression is $5r-23$.
Distribute the $\purple{4}$  to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{4(}\gray{-15-3p}\purple{)} - 4(-p+5) = \purple{-60-12p} - 4(-p+5) $
Distribute the $\purple{-4}$  to each term inside the second set of parentheses:    $\qquad -60-12p \purple{-4(}\gray{-p+5}\purple{)} =-60-12p + \purple{4p-20} $
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{p}$-terms and numeric terms and  then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{-12p + 4p} \blue{-60 - 20}=\pink{-8p} \blue{-80}$
The simplified expression is $-8p-80$.
Distribute the $\purple{-4}$  to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{-4(}\gray{-11+4n}\purple{)} - 3(-2n+9) = \purple{44-16n} - 3(-2n+9)$
Distribute the $\purple{-3}$  to each term inside the second set of parentheses:    $\qquad 44-16n \purple{-3(}\gray{-2n+9}\purple{)}=44-16n + \purple{6n-27}  $
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{n}$-terms and numeric terms, and then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{-16n + 6n}  \blue{+44 - 27}=\pink{-10n}  \blue{+17}$
The simplified expression is $-10n+17$.
Distribute the $\purple{6}$  to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{6(}\gray{7-3y}\purple{)} + 6(y+1) =\purple{42-18y} + 6(y+1) $
Distribute the $\purple{6}$  to each term inside the second set of parentheses:    $\qquad 42-18y + \purple{6(}\gray{y+1}\purple{)} =42-18y + \purple{6y+6} $
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{y}$- terms and numeric terms, and then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{-18y + 6y}  \blue{+42 + 6}=\pink{-12y}  \blue{+48}$
The simplified expression is $-12y+48$.
Distribute the $\purple{2}$ to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{2(}\gray{-2-4p}\purple{)} + 2(-2p-1)=\purple{-4-8p} + 2(-2p-1)  $
Distribute the $\purple{2}$  to each term inside the second set of parentheses:    $\qquad -4-8p + \purple{2(}\gray{-2p-1}\purple{)} = -4-8p \purple{-4p-2}$
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{p}$-terms and numeric terms, and then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{-8p - 4p} \blue{-4 - 2}=\pink{-12p} \blue{-6}$
The simplified expression is $-12p-6$.
Distribute the $\purple{-2}$  to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{-2(}\gray{-5n+6}\purple{)} + 5(2-7n) = \purple{10n-12} + 5(2-7n) $
Distribute the $\purple{5}$  to each term inside the second set of parentheses:    $\qquad 10n-12 + \purple{5(}\gray{2-7n}\purple{)}=10n-12 + \purple{10-35n}  $
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{n}$-terms and numeric terms, and then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{10n - 35n} \blue{-12 + 10}=\pink{-25n} \blue{-2}$
The simplified expression is $-25n-2$.
Distribute the $\purple{-4}$  to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{-4(}\gray{z+3}\purple{)} - 4(5-4z) =\purple{-4z-12} - 4(5-4z) $
Distribute the $\purple{-4}$  to each term inside the second set of parentheses:     $\qquad -4z-12 \purple{-4(}\gray{5-4z}\purple{)} =-4z-12 \purple{-20+16z} $
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{z}$-terms and numeric terms, and then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{-4z + 16z} \blue{-12 - 20}=\pink{12z} \blue{-32}$
The simplified expression is $12z-32$.
Distribute the $\purple{6}$  to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{6(}\gray{5r-11}\purple{)} - (5-r) = \purple{30r-66} - (5-r) $

The minus sign in front of the second set of parentheses means we multiply each term inside the parentheses by $\purple{-1}$:    $\qquad 30r-66 \purple{-1(}\gray{5-r}\purple{)}= 30r-66 \purple{-5+r}  $
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{r}$-terms and numeric terms, and then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{30r + r} \blue{-66 - 5}=\pink{31r} \blue{-71}$
The simplified expression is $31r-71$.
Distribute the $\purple{-5}$  to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{-5(}\gray{3p+3}\purple{)} + 9(-7+p) =\purple{-15p-15} + 9(-7+p) $
Distribute the $\purple{9}$  to each term inside the second set of parentheses:    $\qquad -15p-15 + \purple{9(}\gray{-7+p}\purple{)} =-15p-15 \purple{-63+9p} $
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{p}$- terms and numeric terms, and then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{-15p + 9p} \blue{-15 - 63}=\pink{-6p} \blue{-78}$
The simplified expression is $-6p-78$.
Distribute the $\purple{2}$  to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{2(}\gray{3y+6}\purple{)} - 3(-4-y)=\purple{6y+12} - 3(-4-y)  $
Distribute the $\purple{-3}$  to each term inside the second set of parentheses:    $\qquad 6y+12 \purple{-3(}\gray{-4-y}\purple{)} = 6y+12 + \purple{12+3y} $
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{y}$-terms and numeric terms, and then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{6y + 3y}  \blue{+12 + 12}=\pink{9y}  \blue{+24}$
The simplified expression is $9y+24$.
Distribute the $\purple{2}$ to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{2(}\gray{3r+7}\purple{)} - (2+r) =\purple{6r+14} - (2+r) $
The minus sign in front of the second set of parentheses means we multiply each term inside the parentheses by $\purple{-1}$:    $\qquad 6r+14 \purple{-1(}\gray{2+r}\purple{)} = 6r+14 \purple{-2-r} $
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{r}$-terms and numeric terms, and then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{6r - r}  \blue{+14 - 2}=\pink{5r}  \blue{+12}$
The simplified expression is $5r+12$.
Distribute the $\purple{2}$ to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{2(}\gray{-n-3}\purple{)} - 7(5+2n) =\purple{-2n-6} - 7(5+2n)$
Distribute the $\purple{-7}$  to each term inside the second set of parentheses:    $\qquad -2n-6 \purple{-7(}\gray{5+2n}\purple{)} =-2n-6 \purple{-35-14n}$
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{n}$-terms and numeric terms, and then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{-2n - 14n} \blue{-6 - 35}=\pink{-16n} \blue{-41}$
The simplified expression is $-16n-41$.
Distribute the $\purple{5}$  to each term inside the first set of parentheses:    $\qquad \purple{5(}\gray{10k+1}\purple{)} + 2(2+8k) =\purple{50k+5} + 2(2+8k) $
Distribute the $\purple{2}$ to each term inside the second set of parentheses:    $\qquad 50k+5 + \purple{2(}\gray{2+8k}\purple{)} =50k+5 + \purple{4+16k} $
Rewrite the expression to group the $\pink{k}$-terms and numeric terms, and then combine like terms:    $\qquad\pink{50k + 16k}  \blue{+5 + 4}=\pink{66k}  \blue{+9}$
The simplified expression is $66k+9$.
